title: Tom Brady shows support for Patriots ahead of Super Bowl LX after saying he ‘doesn’t have a dog in the fight’
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Tom Brady initially said he had no preference in Super Bowl LX between the Patriots and Seahawks.
Brady later expressed support for the Patriots on Instagram, encouraging them to win their seventh ring.
Former teammate Vince Wilfork criticized Brady for not publicly backing the Patriots from the start.

title: Former Colts Pro Bowl center thinks Drake Maye should have won NFL MVP over Matthew Stafford
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Matthew Stafford wins NFL MVP by six points over Drake Maye, sparking debate.
Jeff Saturday supports Maye for MVP, citing stronger performance with fewer resources.
ESPN analyst Mina Kimes voted Maye due to his dominance in key statistics.

title: 5 X-factors for Patriots, Seahawks in Super Bowl LX
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Sam Darnold's performance against the Patriots' blitz-heavy defense may determine the Super Bowl LX outcome.
Patriots QB Drake Maye could exploit Seattle's defense by scrambling, given their low ranking in yards allowed per rush.
Patriots linebacker Robert Spillane's injury and Seahawks' running game are key factors for New England's run defense.

title: Patriots get good Drake Maye news on final injury report, but 2 captains are listed as questionable
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Patriots quarterback Drake Maye has no injury designation for Sunday's game, indicating he is fit to play.
Linebackers Harold Landry and Robert Spillane are listed as questionable; they missed parts of practice this week.
Rookie defensive lineman Joshua Farmer is also questionable for the Patriots with a hamstring injury.

title: 5 must-watch movies & TV shows streaming right now
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: 'Hell or High Water' is a modern Western streaming on Netflix about bank-robbing brothers to save their family ranch.
'Splitsville,' a romantic comedy featuring life-altering events, is available for streaming on Hulu.
The 2026 Winter Olympics are streaming on Peacock, offering comprehensive event coverage via the Gold Zone option.

title: ‘We all we got, we all we need’: How Stefon Diggs’s  voice sparked a New England rallying cry
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Stefon Diggs inspired the New England Patriots with the phrase 'we all we got, we all we need' during a key moment.
The phrase has rallied fans and celebrities across New England as the Patriots make an unexpected run to Super Bowl LX.
Diggs faces assault and strangulation charges, but remains a vocal team leader heading into the Super Bowl against the Seahawks.

title: She’s running her first-ever marathon to raise money for Mass. General Hospital
author: Autumn Sloboda
bullets: Armanda Demeris from North Attleboro, Mass., is running her first marathon at the 2026 Boston Marathon.
Demeris is raising funds for the Massachusetts General Hospital Fund, supporting emergency response, cancer care, and veterans' services.
Her motivations include personal connections to emergency services, cancer treatment, and military service, which the fund directly supports.

title: Foodie’s Markets to close South End location, resulting in neighborhood outcry
author: Katelyn Umholtz
bullets: Foodie's Markets South End location will close in June, ending its 28-year presence at 1421 Washington Street.
The closure decision was based on high renovation costs; Croft School withdrew plans to occupy the site after public opposition.
A Change.org petition opposing the site's conversion gathered over 1,500 signatures, urging preservation as a retail or food space.

title: The anonymous Drake Maye Lover Instagram account has developed quite the following
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: The anonymous Instagram account @DrakeMayeLover, dedicated to Patriots quarterback Drake Maye, has nearly 400,000 followers.
The account, created in May 2024 after Maye's draft selection, features memes and sells merchandise related to Maye.
The account owner remains anonymous but indicated to ESPN they might reveal their identity upon meeting Drake Maye.

title: Tom Brady’s Super Bowl LX neutrality strikes a nerve with Patriots fans
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Tom Brady's neutrality about the Patriots in Super Bowl LX has triggered mixed responses from fans.
Brady's comments on the Patriots-Seahawks matchup were seen as neutral, emphasizing a new chapter in New England.
Reader opinions varied from disappointment to understanding, with many feeling Brady remains a 'Patriot for life.'
